commit_message:
Fixes RuntimeError thrown by finalize_properties in Dynamic UI
Fields.

This issue only affects Python 3.0+

RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration is thrown
by the function mentioned above, because it iterates over kwargs
while deleting entries from it.

Change-Id: I4523296be770bddaeffff7f7ded9501ccc42cbdd
Closes-Bug: #1638928

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-04 12:21:00.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ip_lib.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5a3dadc60103a8c2dc88446fe4b2412c9bdf0790', 'message': 'Check if namespace exists before getting devices

If a neutron router has no ports defined, its namespace is deleted
by the cronjob /etc/cron.d/neutron-l3-agent-netns-cleanup.
It is required to check if the namespace exists before calling
iproute2 commands against the namespace.
It is not enough for the string of the namespace uuid to be defined,
the namespace must really exist on the network node.
This patch checks if the namespace exists when calling get_devices().
Otherwise the agent log file will be flooded with messages like
Cannot open network namespace "qrouter-<uuid>": No such file or directory

commit_message:
Check if namespace exists before getting devices

If a neutron router has no ports defined, its namespace is deleted
by the cronjob /etc/cron.d/neutron-l3-agent-netns-cleanup.
It is required to check if the namespace exists before calling
iproute2 commands against the namespace.
It is not enough for the string of the namespace uuid to be defined,
the namespace must really exist on the network node.
This patch checks if the namespace exists when calling get_devices().
Otherwise the agent log file will be flooded with messages like
Cannot open network namespace "qrouter-<uuid>": No such file or directory
Failed to process compatible router '<uuid>'

Related-bug: 1573073

Change-Id: I744ef11529f9da5cbfdb812de0b35b95f9d078bb
(cherry picked from commit 7675495f260daf0174f4e04b36279513889df19a)

commit_message:
Remove deprecated root_volume option

The option from create_server has been deprecated since November 2015 in
favor of a less complex option boot_volume.

Change-Id: I7255dae847978d834e91b051e2c99119589efce9

commit_message:
Add reset of admin node after hang

The first hang can be fixed with reset.
If any other errors appear on that stage,
the error should not be tolerated.

Change-Id: I056879a89cb3cfab45852573730f0ced58043511
Closes-bug: 1587411
(cherry picked from commit 4f486061a9e44f4e2993cd12199d96f873ef7f9e)

added_lines: def provision_admin(admin_node): logger.info("Waiting for admin node to start up") wait(lambda: admin.driver.node_active(admin_node), 60, timeout_msg='Admin node startup timeout') logger.info("Proceed with installation") # update network parameters at boot screen admin_node.send_keys(self.get_keys( admin_node, custom=custom, build_images=build_images, iso_connect_as=iso_connect_as)) if settings.SHOW_FUELMENU: self.wait_for_fuelmenu() else: self.wait_for_provisioning() try: provision_admin(admin) except Exception as e: logger.info('Master node restart: LP1587411') logger.info('Exception is: {e}'.format(e=e)) admin.reset() provision_admin(admin)

commit_message:
Introducing override for all resources in catalog

* override_resources type extended with additional parameter that allows
  to control whether create new resource if it is not in catalog
* override_resources is wrapped with create_resources
* user can put any resource definition in hiera to override its configuration

Change-Id: Ic1f7d856666eb84ced3cef986d8765edf707b481
Blueprint: puppet-resource-override
DocImpact
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/91/391791/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $override_values = values($override_configuration) if !empty($override_values) and has_key($override_values[0], 'data') { # Create resources of type 'override_resources'. These, in turn, # will either update existing resources in the catalog with new data, # or create these resources, if they do not actually exist. create_resources(override_resources, $override_configuration) } else { override_resources { 'neutron_sriov_agent_config': data => $override_configuration['neutron_sriov_agent_config'] }

commit_message:
Replace 'apt-get' to 'apt'

'apt-get' is more primitive command than 'apt'. In addition, 'apt' is
the most recommended interface.[1]

[1]https://debian-handbook.info/browse/stable/sect.apt-get.html

Change-Id: I40dd27f3856a84f936236679cd0201b079a2172e

commit_message:
Add jobs for dev zuul-launcher

* Add jobs for dev zuul-launcher which will run on zuul-dev.o.o
* Update dev zuul layout with same pipelines defined in prod layout.
* Setup zuul-dev layout to trigger on review-dev projects.

Change-Id: Ief59c0b52b196b614f8a7da859c3ba024813f1a3

commit_message:
Restore design spec (protection service level)

the basic design doc for restoration in protection service level

Change-Id: I5976d9f6b368e9415e035ed7319a5773af70cba2
Closes-bug:#1560826
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/50/296950/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================== Restore design spec (protection service level) ============================================== https://bugs.launchpad.net/smaug/+bug/1560826 Protection Service is a component of smaug (an openstack project working as a service for data protection), which is responsible to execute protect/restore/other actions on operations (triggered plans). The restore functionality of protection service is basically about 4 aspects: 1. Restore from what point of data 2. How those resources will look like after restoration 3. In which way we will organize the restoration work. 4. How to watch restoration procedure. The most important assumption we hold here is that the bank of smaug, which holds our protection data, is high available and reliable. Restore from what point ================================================ In `document protection service design <http:// https://raw.githubusercontent.com/openstack/smaug/master/doc/source/spes/protection-service/protection-service.rst>`_ , we have described the procedure to protect resource, where for each protection plan execution, we will persist a checkpoint in bank. If the checkpoint is in status available, the checkpoint is qualified to be a foundation where we can build our restoration. Checkpoint including following data: Plan: -------------------- This item is the plan which used to be executed and thus produced this checkpoint. Resource dependency graph: ---------------------------------- The resource dependency graph describes the resource stack set in the plan, and the dependency among them and their sub resources. This resource dependency graph will help us to check the resources dependency in retrospect. This view is critical since the dependency may vary, e.g., the volume could be attached or detached to a server time by time. However, what we aim to rebuild is the resources stack with same/similar dependency of the original resource stack at the time point of protection. Resource definition data: ------------------------------ Resource definition data is the data defined and persisted by each protection plugin, where protection plugin could persist the metadata of the protection resource, say, backup id, or the original resource, even the data to be backed up/replicated. Those resource definition data could be retrieved during restoration, and could be parameters to rebuild our resources stack. Restore to what =============== The target of restoration is to rebuild the resources stack explicitly set or implied in the protection plan. It means that the resources stack to be protected and rebuilt not only includes the target resources explicitly set in the protection plan, but also includes those resources which the target resources depend on. The smaug protection service will call protection plugin to build the resource stack in the order of the dependencies described by the resource graph (persisted in checkpoint as mentioned above). However, for each kind of resource, to keep what unchanged but what changed is not the responsibility of smaug protection service. It's the implementation of each protection plugin who is free to define their own rules. Say, one server protection plugin may require to keep fixed ip unchanged after restoration, and another server protection plugin may require to keep the attachment device path of one volume to be the same, etc. How to restore ============== Based on our BaseProtectionPlugin, protection plugin implementation with single task doesn¡¯t need care about task flow building but only need implement the restore() function. options to implement ProtectionPlugin restore() -------------------------------------------------- 1. build the corresponding resource, wait it to be available synchronously and return the resource id; 2. build the ¡®resource¡¯ part of heat template of the resource in context and return this ¡®resource¡¯ part of resource template. (Note, here the ¡®resource¡¯ part of heat template means an in-memory class defined by protection service framework); Both ways will do with some resource reference limitations (see below). The second option is for those standard openstack resources which have already been defined by heat resources (url), while the first option is for protection plugins walking around standard openstack resources. how to handle resource references: ---------------------------------- 1. As the resource graph generated during protection, the parent node should take care of the attachment of its children resources. Say, it¡¯s server protection plugin¡¯s work to create attachment resource to attach volumes, and it¡¯s router protection plugin¡¯s work to create the router interface to connect the subnet to the router. 2. To implement restore() function, each resource needs fetch their new built children resources. Since the children resources (could be resource id or the ¡®resource¡¯ part of heat template) could only be generated afer task execution, to retrieve them, the way is to look up from the ¡®requires¡¯ of kwargs, and use the key of the original children resource id. say, to rebuild vm_id1, we find it has one volume_id1 as its child. To retrieve the child task restored new_volume_id1, we use ¡®volume_id_1¡¯ as key and get the value from ¡®requires¡¯ kwargs. 3. If the parent resource protection plugin chooses to option 2 to rebuild resource: return the 'resource' part of heat template, reference of children resource could be resource id or ¡®resource¡¯ part of heat template, the parent resource¡¯s restore() function should check the type of the reference and combine it into its own resource re-building work. 4. If the parent resource protection plugin chooses to option 1 to rebuild resource: rebuild the resource and wait it to be available, and if its child resource protection plugin chooses to follow option2 to rebuild resource: return the 'resource' part of heat template, the limitation is that the parent resource protection plugin may have no way to refer its child resource since the child resource won't get generated even when the task flow gets executed. Considering this limitation, the protection plugin with option1 implementation could choose to extend heat resource to include its own resource building logic. work flow of restoration: ----------------------------- .. image:: http:// https://raw.githubusercontent.com/openstack/smaug/master/doc/images/protection-service/restore-processing-sequence-flow.png 1. User calls API to specify restore from one checkpoint. In protection service, we retrieve the resource graph from checkpoint; 2. Walk through the resource graph and thus build the task flow of restoration; 3. Execute the restoration task flow, which will generate a heat template; 4. User could export this heat template and have heat service to run this template; 5. User could check and watch the procedure of resources stack building; How to restore between two unsymmetrical openstack sites(TBD) ============================================================= Unsymmetrical case including unsymmetrical physical network, vlan to vxlan, different server flavor, different volume type, etc. The basic idea is the protection plugin is free to generate template according to the target site status. It could check target site status through openstack API or config file, and smaug could define some rules to adapt one world to another. Restore heat stack managed resources(TBD) ========================================== The basic idea here is to iterate the original source template, and look up correpsonding resource in protection checkpoint, and thus rebuild the source template with checkpoint data. In this way, the rebuilt resource are still managed by heat stack. How to watch restoration procedure(TBD) ======================================== The basic idea is to watch corresponding heat stack.

commit_message:
Revert "Fix a bug in the algo that determines if a route is possible"

This reverts commit f49be145b1107611e5f7d8ba948f158bb6c057c0.

Change-Id: I2cd9d38b9a52deb12a3378682747058fbfa7a981

deleted_lines: def test_join_with_deep_dependencies_tree(self): wf_text = """--- version: '2.0' wf: tasks: task_a_1: on-success: - task_with_join task_b_1: action: std.fail on-success: - task_b_2 task_b_2: on-success: - task_b_3 task_b_3: on-success: - task_with_join task_with_join: join: all """ wf_service.create_workflows(wf_text) wf_ex = self.engine.start_workflow('wf', {}) self.await_workflow_error(wf_ex.id) with db_api.transaction(): wf_ex = db_api.get_workflow_execution(wf_ex.id) task_execs = wf_ex.task_executions self.assertEqual(3, len(task_execs)) self._assert_single_item( task_execs, name='task_a_1', state=states.SUCCESS ) self._assert_single_item( task_execs, name='task_b_1', state=states.ERROR ) self._assert_single_item( task_execs, name='task_with_join', state=states.ERROR )

commit_message:
devstack: create public network connectivity

On l3 node br-ex isn't connected to public network.
create veth pair, connect it to br-ex and setup routing table for
floating ips.
Thus network connectivity to public network and host is setup.

Change-Id: Ibc45e5771ce07e20b91d503102d28076ed8e18aa

commit_message:
cors: update default configuration

Set_defaults has been added into oslo_middleware. So we use it to
override the configuration defaults. This change has been committed
since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/285368/ has merged.

Change-Id: I75b2ea8febdd1c80f1431cd69d09dd985fd2e51c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/46/394046/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Add nova resources in ci/osresources

Add aggregate, floating-ips-bulk, hypervisor, host, agent
resources in ci/osresources

Change-Id: I6aab0f88821747fa982c27f4d9f8f2fa67726581

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 14.0.2

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Change-Id: I944b1adbf28ac0f2dc50b78702655f81ec32150a
Depends-On: I9f474b0085b4cf1dfe39c8aeda4f965f3fce7d55

commit_message:
Forbid empty value for NTP server list

Default minimum of values in text_list setting value list
was changed from 1 to 0 here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/389195/
So, min=1 limit should be restored
for "NTP server list" setting not to change its functionality.

Related-Bug: #1613614

Change-Id: If354f86c5cd11fe7eb0dc07c7c4d1048dcb75363

commit_message:
bagpipe: rely on ROUTER_INTERFACE registry callbacks

This change replaces the code trying to detect new router
interfaces based on PORT create/update notifications, by code simply
listening on ROUTER_INTERFACE created/deleted notifications.

Including this fix in stable/newtonn is made possible because Neutron 9.1.0 has the fix this change depends on.

Change-Id: Ibab3ab2adfc636d4a48775ea7e9ac7ffdf53dcdf
Closes-Bug: 1629358
(cherry picked from commit 6dad68b260462075d1f3627b0325bb1992c2ccb1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/36/393636/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _log_callback_processing_exception(resource, event, trigger, kwargs, e): LOG.exception(_LE("Error during notification processing " "%(resource)s %(event)s, %(trigger)s, " "%(kwargs)s: %(exc)s"), {'trigger': trigger, 'resource': resource, 'event': event, 'kwargs': kwargs, 'exc': e}) registry.subscribe(self.registry_port_updated, resources.PORT, registry.subscribe(self.registry_port_deleted, resources.PORT, registry.subscribe(self.registry_router_interface_created, resources.ROUTER_INTERFACE, registry.subscribe(self.registry_router_interface_deleted, resources.ROUTER_INTERFACE, events.AFTER_DELETE) def notify_router_interface_created(self, context, router_id, net_id): net_assoc = {'network_id': net_id, def notify_router_interface_deleted(self, context, router_id, net_id): self.notify_port_updated(context, port, original_port) except Exception as e: _log_callback_processing_exception(resource, event, trigger, kwargs, e) self.notify_port_deleted(context, port) except Exception as e: _log_callback_processing_exception(resource, event, trigger, kwargs, e) def registry_router_interface_created(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): router_id = kwargs['router_id'] net_id = kwargs['port']['network_id'] self.notify_router_interface_created(context, router_id, net_id) except Exception as e: _log_callback_processing_exception(resource, event, trigger, kwargs, e) @log_helpers.log_method_call def registry_router_interface_deleted(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): try: context = kwargs['context'] # for router_interface after_delete, in stable/newton, the # callback does not include the router_id directly, but we find # it in the port device_id router_id = kwargs['port']['device_id'] net_id = kwargs['port']['network_id'] self.notify_router_interface_deleted(context, router_id, net_id) except Exception as e: _log_callback_processing_exception(resource, event, trigger, kwargs, e)
deleted_lines: registry.subscribe(self.registry_port_updated, resources.PORT, registry.subscribe(self.registry_port_deleted, resources.PORT, registry.subscribe(self.registry_port_created, resources.PORT, def router_interface_added(self, context, port): net_id = port['network_id'] router_id = port['device_id'] net_assoc = {'network_id': port['network_id'], def router_interface_removed(self, context, port): net_id = port['network_id'] router_id = port['device_id'] rtr_itf_added = self._is_router_intf_added(original_port, port) rtr_itf_removed = self._is_router_intf_added(port, original_port) if rtr_itf_added: self.router_interface_added(context, port) elif rtr_itf_removed: self.router_interface_removed(context, original_port) else: self.notify_port_updated(context, port, original_port) except Exception as e: LOG.exception(_LE("Error during notification processing " "%(resource)s %(event)s, %(trigger)s, " "%(kwargs)s: %(exc)s"), {'trigger': trigger, 'resource': resource, 'event': event, 'kwargs': kwargs, 'exc': e}) def _is_router_intf_added(self, original_port, port): if not (original_port and port): # This happens when the ml2 rpc.py sends a port update # notification. original port will be None. However, this rpc # notification will never be from a port device_id/device_owner # update, so return False return False return (original_port['device_owner'] != const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF == port['device_owner']) if port['device_owner'] == const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF: self.router_interface_removed(context, port) else: self.notify_port_deleted(context, port) except Exception as e: LOG.exception(_LE("Error during notification processing " "%(resource)s %(event)s, %(trigger)s, " "%(kwargs)s: %(exc)s"), {'trigger': trigger, 'resource': resource, 'event': event, 'kwargs': kwargs, 'exc': e}) def registry_port_created(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): port = kwargs['port'] if port['device_owner'] == const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF: self.router_interface_added(context, port) except Exception as e: LOG.exception(_LE("Error during notification processing " "%(resource)s %(event)s, %(trigger)s, " "%(kwargs)s: %(exc)s"), {'trigger': trigger, 'resource': resource, 'event': event, 'kwargs': kwargs, 'exc': e})

subject: text_list attributes could be empty
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-21 11:19:22.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/fixtures/openstack.yaml', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/validators/json_schema/base_types.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/02927123f4081d2589281cedd5bb54074d7affed', 'message': 'text_list attributes could be empty

commit_message:
text_list attributes could be empty

The issue is that sometimes users want
to be able to have emtpy lists for
some attributes like for example upstream
dns.

Change-Id: Ib96b0cb051892e50f26a46ce33eeb477ef2a36f1
Related-Bug: #1613614

deleted_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-11-01 16:47+0000\n"msgid "" "Create a policy entry using the :command:`rbac-create` command (in this " "example, the ID of the project we want to share with is " "``e28769db97d9449da658bc6931fcb683``):" msgstr "" ":command:`rbac-create` コマンドを使ってポリシーエントリーを作成します (この例" "では、共有対象のプロジェクト ID は ``e28769db97d9449da658bc6931fcb683`` で" "す)。" "Create the RBAC policy entry using the :command:`rbac-create` command (in " "this example, the ID of the project we want to share with is " "``a6bf6cfbcd1f4e32a57d2138b6bd41d1``):" msgstr "" ":command:`rbac-create` コマンドを使って RBAC ポリシーエントリーを作成します " "(この例では、共有対象のプロジェクト ID は " "``a6bf6cfbcd1f4e32a57d2138b6bd41d1`` です)。" msgid ""msgid "" "Create the policy entry using the :command:`rbac-create` command (in this " "example, the ID of the project we want to share with is " "``e28769db97d9449da658bc6931fcb683``):" msgstr "" ":command:`rbac-create` コマンドを使ってポリシーエントリーを作成します (この例" "では、共有対象のプロジェクト ID は ``e28769db97d9449da658bc6931fcb683`` で" "す)。" msgid "" "Now project ``e28769db97d9449da658bc6931fcb683`` is able to see the network " "when running :command:`net-list` and :command:`net-show` and can attach " "router gateway ports to that network. No other users (other than admins and " "the owner) are able to see the network." msgstr "" "この時点で、プロジェクト ``e28769db97d9449da658bc6931fcb683`` が :command:" "`net-list` や :command:`net-show` を実行すると、このネットワークが見えます" "し、このネットワークにルーターのゲートウェイポートを接続できます。 (管理者と" "所有者以外の) 他のユーザーにはこのネットワークは見えません。" "Project ``a6bf6cfbcd1f4e32a57d2138b6bd41d1`` will now be able to see the QoS " "policy when running :command:`qos-policy-list` and :command:`qos-policy-" "show` and will also be able to bind it to its ports or networks. No other " "users (other than admins and the owner) will be able to see the QoS policy." msgstr "" "この時点で、プロジェクト ``a6bf6cfbcd1f4e32a57d2138b6bd41d1`` が :command:" "`qos-policy-list` や :command:`qos-policy-show` を実行すると、この QoS ポリ" "シーが見えますし、この QoS ポリシーをネットワークのポートに結び付けることもで" "きます。 (管理者と所有者以外の) 他のユーザーにはこの QoS ポリシーは見えませ" "ん。" msgid "" "Project ``e28769db97d9449da658bc6931fcb683`` will now be able to see the " "network when running :command:`net-list` and :command:`net-show` and will " "also be able to create ports on that network. No other users (other than " "admins and the owner) will be able to see the network." msgstr "" "この時点で、プロジェクト ``e28769db97d9449da658bc6931fcb683`` が :command:" "`net-list` や :command:`net-show` を実行すると、このネットワークが見えます" "し、このネットワークにポートを作成することもできます。 (管理者と所有者以外" "の) 他のユーザーにはこのネットワークは見えません。" msgid ""msgid "The :command:`agent-show` command shows details for a specified agent:" msgstr "" ":command:`agent-show` コマンドは、指定したエージェントの詳細を表示します。" "The same can explicitly be accomplished by a user with administrative " "credentials setting the flags in the :command:`router-create` command:" msgstr "" "管理者権限を持つユーザーがこれらのフラグを :command:`router-create` コマンド" "で指定して、同じことを明示的に行うこともできます。" msgid """This is the equivalent of creating a policy on the network that permits " "every project to perform the action ``access_as_shared`` on that network. " "Neutron treats them as the same thing, so the policy entry for that network " "should be visible using the :command:`rbac-list` command:" msgstr "" "これは、このネットワークへの ``access_as_shared`` アクションをすべてのプロ" "ジェクトに対して許可するポリシーを作成するのと等価です。 neutron は両者を同じ" "ものとして扱います。したがって、 :command:`rbac-list` コマンドを使うと、この" "ネットワークに対するポリシーエントリーが見えます。" msgid """To remove access for that project, delete the RBAC policy that allows it " "using the :command:`rbac-delete` command:" msgstr "" "このプロジェクトへのアクセス許可を削除するには、 :command:`rbac-delete` コマ" "ンドを使って、作成した RBAC ポリシーを削除します。" msgid "" "To remove access for that project, delete the policy that allows it using " "the :command:`rbac-delete` command:" msgstr "" "このプロジェクトへのアクセス許可を削除するには、 :command:`rbac-delete` コマ" "ンドを使って、作成したポリシーを削除します。" msgid ""msgid "Use the :command:`rbac-show` command to see the details:" msgstr ":command:`rbac-show` を使うと、詳細を確認できます。" "When you run :command:`net-list` or :command:`net-show`, the ``shared`` flag " "is calculated by the server based on the calling project and the RBAC " "entries for each network. For QoS objects use :command:`qos-policy-list` or :" "command:`qos-policy-show` respectively. If there is a wildcard entry, the " "``shared`` flag is always set to ``True``. If there are only entries that " "share with specific projects, only the projects the object is shared to will " "see the flag as ``True`` and the rest will see the flag as ``False``." msgstr "" ":command:`net-list` や :command:`net-show` が実行されると、 ``shared`` フラグ" "は、呼び出したプロジェクトと各ネットワークの RBAC エントリーに基いてサーバー" "で計算されます。 QoS ポリシーの場合は、それぞれ :command:`qos-policy-list` " "or :command:`qos-policy-show` が対応します。ワイルドカードエントリーがあれ" "ば、 ``shared`` フラグは常に ``True`` にセットされます。存在するのが特定のプ" "ロジェクトとの共有だけの場合は、そのオブジェクトが共有されたプロジェクトでは " "``shared`` フラグが ``True`` に見え、他のプロジェクトではフラグは ``False`` " "に見えます。" msgid ""

commit_message:
Fix DB API transaction()

* start_tx() should not be under 'try' because we can't do
  any clean up actions if it fails. The best thing we can do is
  to bubble up the error to the user.

Change-Id: Id2c12cd0837673d52260c58782327570745968ce
Partial-Bug: #1638805
(cherry picked from commit 90460cb5b7021d92e4a4bf0ee68d52762ded3641)

commit_message:
Revert "Add one more test for YAQL error message format",
other backport patches were cherrypicked in the wrong way
this resulted in merge conflicts, need to revert
this before the other pathches.

This reverts commit 715221b34dd850f83f4c4d6f98af314b9c0fd8c5.

Change-Id: Id24d1a6fa7cb2e85ca03cb10c26571e367c6cbb0

commit_message:
Replace oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

'oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime()' is deprecated in version '1.6' and
will be removed in a future version: use datetime.datetime.isoformat()
instead.For more informations:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.utils/api/timeutils.html#oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

Change-Id: I506d0a3799aef4358a390bc28c2a36dc4c7d2a3e
Closes-Bug: #1514331
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/38/394338/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: * List agents to verify successful launch of the neutron agents: .. code-block:: console $ openstack network agent list +--------------------------------------+--------------------+------------+-------------------+-------+-------+---------------------------+ | ID | Agent Type | Host | Availability Zone | Alive | State | Binary | +--------------------------------------+--------------------+------------+-------------------+-------+-------+---------------------------+ | f49a4b81-afd6-4b3d-b923-66c8f0517099 | Metadata agent | controller | None | True | UP | neutron-metadata-agent | | 27eee952-a748-467b-bf71-941e89846a92 | Linux bridge agent | controller | None | True | UP | neutron-linuxbridge-agent | | 08905043-5010-4b87-bba5-aedb1956e27a | Linux bridge agent | compute1 | None | True | UP | neutron-linuxbridge-agent | | 830344ff-dc36-4956-84f4-067af667a0dc | L3 agent | controller | nova | True | UP | neutron-l3-agent | | dd3644c9-1a3a-435a-9282-eb306b4b0391 | DHCP agent | controller | nova | True | UP | neutron-dhcp-agent | +--------------------------------------+--------------------+------------+-------------------+-------+-------+---------------------------+ .. end The output should indicate four agents on the controller node and one agent on each compute node.

commit_message:
Replace oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

Function 'oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime()' is deprecated in version '1.6' and
will be removed in a future version. We  use datetime.datetime.isoformat()
instead. For more informations:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.utils/api/timeutils.html#oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

Change-Id: I199c909681ff798fc6c06b0dfa69c787037bdaf2
Closes-Bug: #1514331

commit_message:
Collect logs even when timeout

Collect the tripleo-ci logs, even when the job fails with timeout.
The logs are only being collected when the job finishes (even as
success or error), but not when it timeout, which make hard to find out
the root cause of the timeout.

Closes-Bug: #1618003
Change-Id: Ia2fe16edb9025a859ad8b7d9b33646959480939b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/10/392610/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We want to collect the logs, even if fails with timeout EXIT_CODE=$? if [ $EXIT_CODE -eq 137 ] ; then source /opt/stack/new/tripleo-ci/scripts/common_vars.bash source /opt/stack/new/tripleo-ci/scripts/common_functions.sh postci \$EXIT_CODE 2>&1 | ts '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S.000 |' > $WORKSPACE/logs/postci.log 2>&1 fi exit $EXIT_CODE

commit_message:
publisher: make direct publisher generic

The direct publisher was hardcoding database as dispatcher to use.
But all dispatchers have the same interface, so allow the deployer
to configure which one it want to use.

Change-Id: I9dc48f25ba6d846ee75785ee529798af5085a53a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/39/345239/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import logimport six.moves.urllib.parse as urlparse from stevedore import driver import stevedore.exception from ceilometer.i18n import _LELOG = log.getLogger(__name__) Samples are saved to a configured dispatcher. This is useful where it is desirable to limit the number of external services that are required. By default, the database dispatcher is used to select another one we can use direct://?dispatcher=gnocchi, direct://?dispatcher=http, direct://?dispatcher=log, ... """ options = urlparse.parse_qs(parsed_url.query) self.dispatcher_name = options.get('dispatcher', ['database'])[-1] self._sample_dispatcher = None self._event_dispatcher = None try: self.sample_driver = driver.DriverManager( 'ceilometer.dispatcher.meter', self.dispatcher_name) except stevedore.exception.NoMatches: self.sample_driver = None try: self.event_driver = driver.DriverManager( 'ceilometer.dispatcher.event', self.dispatcher_name) except stevedore.exception.NoMatches: self.event_driver = None def get_sample_dispatcher(self): if not self._sample_dispatcher: self._sample_dispatcher = self.sample_driver(cfg.CONF) return self._sample_dispatcher def get_event_dispatcher(self): if not self._event_dispatcher: if self.event_driver != self.sample_driver: self._event_dispatcher = self.event_driver(cfg.CONF) else: self._event_dispatcher = self.get_sample_dispatcher() return self._event_dispatcher if not self.sample_driver: LOG.error(_LE("Can't publish samples to a non-existing dispatcher " "'%s'"), self.dispatcher_name) return self.get_sample_dispatcher().record_metering_data([ self._sample_to_recordable_data(sample) ]) if not self.event_driver: LOG.error(_LE("Can't publish events to a non-existing dispatcher" "'%s'"), self.dispatcher_name) return self.get_event_dispatcher().record_events(events) @staticmethod def _sample_to_recordable_data(sample): meter = utils.meter_message_from_counter( sample, cfg.CONF.publisher.telemetry_secret) if meter.get('timestamp'): ts = timeutils.parse_isotime(meter['timestamp']) meter['timestamp'] = timeutils.normalize_time(ts) return meter
deleted_lines: from ceilometer.dispatcher import database Samples are saved to the currently configured database by hitching a ride on the DatabaseDispatcher. This is useful where it is desirable to limit the number of external services that are required. """ dispatcher = database.DatabaseDispatcher(cfg.CONF) self.meter_conn = dispatcher.meter_conn self.event_conn = dispatcher.event_conn # Transform the Sample objects into a list of dicts meters = [ utils.meter_message_from_counter( sample, cfg.CONF.publisher.telemetry_secret) ] for meter in meters: if meter.get('timestamp'): ts = timeutils.parse_isotime(meter['timestamp']) meter['timestamp'] = timeutils.normalize_time(ts) self.meter_conn.record_metering_data(meter) self.event_conn.record_events(events)

commit_message:
add getting aodh alarms from notifications

Implements: blueprint aodh-message-bus-notifications
Signed-off-by: dongwenjuan <dong.wenjuan@zte.com.cn>
Change-Id: I2b0ab5023b7182a15fa831fc43d17466fd5149ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage-specs refs/changes/54/393654/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================== Aodh Message Bus Notifications ============================== Add Aodh alarms immediately via notification from the message bus. Problem description =================== Currently Aodh datasource queries Aodh alarms periodically. It is not in time and it is also not efficient, since most query will get no change when the interval of alarm evaluation in Aodh is larger than the interval of pulling Aodh alarm in Vitrage. Proposed change =============== Aodh `update_method` in vitrage config file will be configured with: /etc/vitrage/vitrage.conf ``` [aodh] update_method = push Add a new notification topic in Aodh config file: /etc/aodh/aodh.conf ``` [oslo_messaging_notifications] topics = vitrage_notifications Vitrage listener will get the alarm events from message bus and notify the Synchronizer upon a change in an Aodh alarm definition or state. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Pipeline impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- None Other deployer impact --------------------- ** Config `update_method` as 'push' in `Aodh` section in vitrage config file. ** Add the `vitrage_notifications` topic in `oslo_messaging_notifications` section in Aodh config file. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: dongwenjuan <dong.wenjuan@zte.com.cn> Work Items ---------- None Future lifecycle ================ None Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests and tempest tests. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: Ia6f55ae6fd6270d03e6bf0541d577cd862b3a16b
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] Implemented that nova-scheduler determines the evacuate host

Add implementation when recovery_method is 'Auto'.
This case is that nova-scheduler determines the evacuate host.

Change-Id: Ib8bca750189a60a779bbc96656bb593ca55666ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari refs/changes/26/380926/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from masakari.objects import fields self.field_recovery_method = fields.FailoverSegmentRecoveryMethod() if recovery_method == self.field_recovery_method.AUTO: reserve_host = None elif recovery_method == self.field_recovery_method.RESERVED_HOST: reserve_host = self.util_db.get_reserved_host(ctxt, else: # TODO(takahara.kengo): # In the future, add implementation of case that # recovery_method is 'AUTO_PRIORITY' or 'RH_PRIORITY'. reserve_host = None
deleted_lines: reserve_host = None if recovery_method == 'RH': reserve_host = self.util_db.get_reserve_host(ctxt,

commit_message:
Use oslo_config to manage configuration about engine

Implementation using oslo_config.
With this implementation, masakari-engine can get the config value using
the oslo_config library.

Change-Id: I0504ac10d3853e3b6995148a4148036cd54f82d0

commit_message:
Implemented the RPC support,load the recovery logic,and TaskFlow

Commit the following implementation
- Implemented to receive RPC messages from masakari-api.
- The recovery logic was to be set from the value of the configuration
  file.
- Implemented to use TaskFlow library.

Change-Id: I1f41eb95eb0a0964a0f29bca8014709abd894b93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari refs/changes/68/373068/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # Copyright(c) 2015 Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corporation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. """ This file defines the MasakariEngine class. """ import datetime import eventlet import logging import masakari.conf from masakari.engine.utils import LogProcessBeginAndEnd from masakari.engine.utils import MasakariUtilDb as dbutil from masakari.engine.utils import MasakariUtil as util import os from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_context import context from oslo_log import log as oslo_logging import oslo_messaging import sys import signal from stevedore import driver import threading import traceback import time parentdir = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), os.path.pardir)) # rootdir = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(parentdir, os.path.pardir)) # project root directory needs to be add at list head rather than tail # this file named 'masakari' conflicts to the directory name if parentdir not in sys.path: sys.path = [parentdir] + sys.path CONF = masakari.conf.CONF LOG = oslo_logging.getLogger(__name__) log_process_begin_and_end = LogProcessBeginAndEnd(LOG) eventlet.monkey_patch(os=False) DRIVER_MANAGER = None class MasakariEndpoint(object): """ MasakariEndpoint class: This class define the recover method, that is endpoint of RPC server. """ # TODO: (nttsoft) RPC method will integrated into one method. def __init__(self, dbutil, util): oslo_logging.set_defaults( logging_context_format_string=CONF.logging_context_format_string, default_log_levels=oslo_logging.get_default_log_levels()) context.RequestContext() self.dbutil = dbutil self.util = util @log_process_begin_and_end.output_log def recover_instance(self, ctxt_vm): try: # Output id column of notification table. msg = "Recieved message. id = %s." % str( ctxt_vm.get("notification_id")) LOG.info(msg) th_name = self.util.make_thread_name( "recover_instance", ctxt_vm.get("notification_id")) th = threading.Thread(target=DRIVER_MANAGER.recover_instance, name=th_name, args=(ctxt_vm)) except: error_type, error_value, traceback_ = sys.exc_info() tb_list = traceback.format_tb(traceback_) LOG.error(error_type) LOG.error(error_value) for tb in tb_list: LOG.error(tb) @log_process_begin_and_end.output_log def recover_host(self, ctxt_host): try: # Output id column of notification table. msg = "Recieved message. id = %s." % str( ctxt_host.get("notification_id")) LOG.info(msg) th_name = self.util.make_thread_name( "recover_host", ctxt_vm.get("notification_id")) th = threading.Thread(target=DRIVER_MANAGER.recover_host, name=th_name, args=(ctxt_vm)) except: error_type, error_value, traceback_ = sys.exc_info() tb_list = traceback.format_tb(traceback_) LOG.error(error_type) LOG.error(error_value) for tb in tb_list: LOG.error(tb) @log_process_begin_and_end.output_log def recover_process(self, ctxt_proc): try: # Output id column of notification table. msg = "Recieved message. id = %s." % str( ctxt_proc.get("notification_id")) LOG.info(msg) th_name = self.util.make_thread_name( "recover_process", ctxt_vm.get("args").get("notification_id")) th = threading.Thread(target=DRIVER_MANAGER.recover_process, name=th_name, args=(ctxt_vm)) except: error_type, error_value, traceback_ = sys.exc_info() tb_list = traceback.format_tb(traceback_) LOG.error(error_type) LOG.error(error_value) for tb in tb_list: LOG.error(tb) class MasakariEngine(object): """ MasakariEngine class: This class starts the RPC server, and waits for notification of the failure detection process on the ComputeNode. If this class received notification, it starts thread that executes the VM recovery process according to the contents of the notification. """ def __init__(self): try: oslo_logging.set_defaults( logging_context_format_string=CONF.logging_context_format_string, default_log_levels=oslo_logging.get_default_log_levels()) context.RequestContext() self.dbutil = dbutil() self.util = util() msg = "Succeeded in reading the configration file." LOG.info(msg) # Determine dynamic load driver from congiguration. driver_name = CONF.recover_driver # Load the driver to global. global DRIVER_MANAGER DRIVER_MANAGER = driver.DriverManager( namespace='masakari.recover.driver', name=driver_name, invoke_on_load=True, invoke_args=(), ) except Exception as e: logger = logging.getLogger() logger.setLevel(logging.ERROR) f = "%(asctime)s " + \ " masakari(%(process)d): %(levelname)s: %(message)s'" formatter = logging.Formatter(fmt=f, datefmt='%b %d %H:%M:%S') # create log dir if not created log_dir = '/var/log/masakari/' if not os.path.isdir(log_dir): os.makedirs(log_dir) fh = logging.FileHandler( filename='/var/log/masakari/masakari-controller.log') fh.setLevel(logging.ERROR) fh.setFormatter(formatter) logger.addHandler(fh) msg = ("An error during initializing masakari controller: %s" % e) logger.critical(msg) error_type, error_value, traceback_ = sys.exc_info() tb_list = traceback.format_tb(traceback_) logger.critical(error_type) logger.critical(error_value) for tb in tb_list: logger.critical(tb) logger.removeHandler(fh) sys.exit() @log_process_begin_and_end.output_log def masakari(self): try: LOG.info("masakari START.") # Get a session and do not pass it to other threads session = self.dbutil.get_session() # Reprocessing unprocessed notifications. self._update_too_old_notifications(session) notifications = self.dbutil.get_reprocessing_notifications( session) if len(notifications) > 0: self._reprocess_notifications(self, notifications) # RPC server construction. transport = oslo_messaging.get_transport(cfg.CONF) # TODO: # The value of topic, server, version are expected # to be able to set in the configuration file. # TODO: #3443 トピックの命名変更必要。バージョンは不要 # Get from cinfig topic = CONF.topic server = CONF.server target = oslo_messaging.Target(topic=topic, server=server, version='1.0') endpoints = [ MasakariEndpoint(self.dbutil, self.util), ] # TODO: (nttsoft) #3443 Need to check about context serializer. server = oslo_messaging.get_rpc_server( transport, target, endpoints, executor='eventlet') # start server. server.start() LOG.info("masakari-controller started.") # This method is called when masakari-controller stopped # by service command. def _sigterm_handler(signo, frame): raise EnvironmentError( "masakari-controller received SIGTERM.") signal.signal(signal.SIGTERM, _sigterm_handler) while True: time.sleep(1) except EnvironmentError: # When catching EnvironmentError by received SIGTERM, # stop server. _, error_value, _ = sys.exc_info() LOG.warning(error_value) server.stop() server.wait() except: error_type, error_value, traceback_ = sys.exc_info() tb_list = traceback.format_tb(traceback_) LOG.critical(error_type) LOG.critical(error_value) for tb in tb_list: LOG.critical(tb) finally: LOG.info("masakari-controller stopped.") sys.exit() @log_process_begin_and_end.output_log def _reprocess_notifications(self, notifications): # Description: Reprocess notification. for notification in notifications: prm = self._make_param(notification) if notification["type"] == 1: # COMPUTE_HOST(node) DRIVER_MANAGER.recover_host(prm) elif notification["type"] == 2: # VM(instanse) DRIVER_MANAGER.recover_instance(prm) elif notification["type"] == 3: # PROCESS(process) DRIVER_MANAGER.recover_process(prm) else: # Invalid notification type at reprocess. msg = ("Invalid notification type %s"\ % notification["type"]) raise ValueError(msg) @log_process_begin_and_end.output_log def _make_param(self, notification): # TODO: (nttsoft) RPC schema is Under Review. # Description: Make prameter for recover method. # # expected payload is following. # COMPUTE_HOST_PAYLOAD # {"event": "STOPPED/STARTED", # "host_status": "NORMAL/UNKNOWN", # "cluster_status": "ONLINE/OFFLINE"} # # PROCESS_PAYLOAD # { "event": "STOPPED", # "process_name": "Name of process"} # # VM_PAYLOAD # { "event": "Event name from VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_ID_*", # "instance_uuid": ”<instance uuid>", # "vir_domain_event": "Detail event code from VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_*”} self.prm = "" # TODO: (nttsoft) RPC schema is Under Review. if notification["type"] == 1:# COMPUTE_HOST(node) self.prm = { 'method': "recover_host", 'namespace': "masakari.engine", 'args': { 'hostname': notification["hostname"], 'timestamp': notification["timestamp"], 'notification_uuid':notification["payload"], 'event': notification["payload"]["event"], 'host_status': notification["payload"]["host_status"], 'cluster_status': notification["payload"]["cluster_status"], } } elif notification["type"] == 2: # VM(instanse) # TODO: (nttsoft) RPC schema is Under Review. self.prm = { 'method': "recover_instance", 'namespace': "masakari.engine", 'args': { 'hostname': notification["hostname"], 'timestamp': notification["timestamp"], 'notification_uuid':notification["notification_uuid"], 'event': notification["payload"]["event"], 'instance_uuid': notification["payload"]["instance_uuid"], 'vir_domain_event': notification["payload"]["vir_domain_event"], } } else: # PROCESS(process) expected type == 3 # TODO: (nttsoft) RPC schema is Under Review. self.prm = { 'method': "recover_instance", 'namespace': "masakari.engine", 'args': { 'hostname': notification["hostname"], 'timestamp': notification["timestamp"], 'notification_uuid':notification["notification_uuid"], 'event': notification["payload"]["event"], 'process_name': notification["payload"]["process_name"], } } return self.prm @log_process_begin_and_end.output_log def _update_too_old_notifications(self, session): # Description: Finished the too old notification. # Get notification_expiration_sec from config # TODO: (nttsoft)configuration name of 'recover_starter' # config class -> use oslo_config. notification_expiration_sec = CONF.notification_expiration_sec # Get border time now = datetime.datetime.now() border_time = now - datetime.timedelta( seconds=notification_expiration_sec) msg = "Do get_old_records_notification." LOG.info(msg) notifications = self.dbutil.get_old_records_notification(session, border_time) msg = "Succeeded in get_old_records_notification. " \ + "Return_value = " + str(notifications) LOG.info(msg) for notification in notifications: msg = "Do delete_expired_notification." LOG.info(msg) self.dbutil.delete_expired_notification( session, datetime.datetime.now(), datetime.datetime.now(), notification["id"]) msg = "Succeeded in delete_expired_notification." LOG.info(msg)

added_lines: # for engine def get_all_notification_by_id(session, notification_id): """Get type from notification table. :param session: Session object. :param notification_id: Notification ID. (updated narrowing condition of notification table) :returns: Event type. """ return IMPL.get_all_notification_by_id(session, notification_id) def get_one_notification_by_uuid_created_at_last(session, instance_uuid): """Get one notification type of VM created at last. :param session: Session object. :param instance_uuid: Event occurs instance uuid. :returns: Same instance record, created at last. """ return IMPL.get_one_notification_by_uuid_created_at_last( session, instance_uuid) def get_one_notification_by_uuid_and_status_created_at_last( session, instance_uuid): """Get one notification type of VM created at last. :param session: Session object. :param instance_uuid: Event occurs instance uuid. :returns: Same instance record, status "new" or "running". """ return IMPL.get_one_notification_by_uuid_and_status_created_at_last( session, instance_uuid) def update_notification_by_id_dict(session, notification_uuid, update_val): """Notification table update. :param session: Session object. :param update_val: Updated value. :param notification_uuid: Notification uuid. (updated narrowing condition of notification table) """ return IMPL.update_notification_by_id_dict( session, notification_uuid, update_val) def get_recovery_method(session, hostname): """Get recovery_method from failover_segment table. :param session: Session object. :param hostname: Event occurs host name. :returns: Failover_segment table recovery_method. """ return IMPL.get_recovery_method(session, hostname) def get_failover_segment_id_by_hostname(session, hostname): """Get failover_segment_id from host table. :param session: Session object. :param hostname: Event occurs host name. :returns: Failover_segment_id. """ return IMPL.get_failover_segment_id_by_hostname(session, hostname) def get_reserved_host(session, FS_id, hostname): """Get reserved host from host table. :param session: Session object. :param FS_id: Failover_segment_id. :param hostname: Event occurs host name. :returns: Reserved host name. """ return IMPL.get_reserved_host(session, FS_id, hostname) def get_old_notifications(session, border_time): """Get old records from notification table. :param session: Session object. :param border_time: Time to determine the old record. :returns: Of notification table, old record ID. """ return IMPL.get_old_notifications(session, border_time) def delete_expired_notification(session, update_at, delete_at, notification_id): """Delete expired record from notification table. :param session: Session object. :param update_at: Current time. :param delete_at: Current time. :param notification_id: Expired record id of notification table. """ return IMPL.delete_expired_notification( session, update_at, delete_at, notification_id) def get_reprocessing_notifications(session): """Get records from notification table of status "new". :param session: Session object. :returns: Reprocessing records of notification table. """ return IMPL.get_reprocessing_notifications(session) def get_reprocessing_records_list(session, notification_uuid): """Get reprocessing records from notification table. :param session: Session object. :param notification_uuid: Reprocessing record uuid of notification table. :returns: Reprocessing records of notification table. """ return IMPL.get_reprocessing_records_list(session, notification_uuid) def update_reprocessing_records( session, status, update_at, delete_at, notification_id): """Update reprocessing records from notification table. :param session: Session object. :param status: Status after update. :param update_at: Current time. :param delete_at: Current time. :param notification_id: Reprocessing record id of notification table. """ return IMPL.update_reprocessing_records( session, status, update_at, delete_at, notification_id) def get_distinct_hostname_by_host(session): """Get distinct hostname by host. :param session: Session object. :returns: Distinct hostname of host table. """ return IMPL.get_distinct_hostname_by_host(session) def get_notification_by_hostname(session, hostname): """Get notification by hostname. :param session: Session object. :param hostname: Distinct hostname. :returns: Notification table record by row.name. """ return IMPL.get_notification_by_hostname(session, hostname) def get_all_notification_by_status(session, instance_uuid): """Get all notification by status. :param session: Session object. :param instance_uuid: Event occurs VM uuid. :returns: VM uuid of status "new" or "running". """ return IMPL.get_all_notification_by_status(session, instance_uuid) def get_notification_by_instance_uuid_and_status_sorted(session, instance_uuid): """Get notification record by instance_uuid. :param session: Session object. :param instance_uuid: Reprocessing VM uuid. :returns : Notification records of reprocessing VM recovery. """ return IMPL.get_notification_by_instance_uuid_and_status_sorted( session, instance_uuid) def get_records_by_instance_uuid(session, instance_uuid): """Get notification type of VM uuid = instance_uuid. :param session: Session object. :param instance_uuid: Event occurs instance uuid. :returns : Same instance record, created at last. """ return IMPL.get_records_by_instance_uuid(session, instance_uuid) def get_session(engine): """Returns database session""" return IMPL.get_session(engine)

deleted_lines: from senlin.common import consts def test_receiver_create_webhook_succeed(self, mock_create, mock_find): fake_cluster = mock.Mock() fake_cluster.user = self.ctx.user mock_find.return_value = fake_cluster fake_receiver = mock.Mock(id='FAKE_RECIEVER') fake_receiver.to_dict.return_value = { 'id': 'FAKE_RECEIVER', 'foo': 'bar' } mock_create.return_value = fake_receiver result = self.eng.receiver_create(self.ctx, 'r1', 'webhook', 'C1', 'CLUSTER_RESIZE') self.assertIsInstance(result, dict) self.assertEqual('FAKE_RECEIVER', result['id']) mock_find.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'C1') mock_create.assert_called_once_with( self.ctx, 'webhook', fake_cluster, 'CLUSTER_RESIZE', name='r1', user=self.ctx.user, project=self.ctx.project, domain=self.ctx.domain, params={}) # test params passed mock_create.reset_mock() self.eng.receiver_create(self.ctx, 'r1', 'webhook', 'C1', 'CLUSTER_RESIZE', params={'FOO': 'BAR'}) mock_create.assert_called_once_with( self.ctx, 'webhook', fake_cluster, 'CLUSTER_RESIZE', name='r1', user=self.ctx.user, project=self.ctx.project, domain=self.ctx.domain, params={'FOO': 'BAR'}) @mock.patch.object(ro.Receiver, 'get_by_name') def test_receiver_create_name_duplicated(self, mock_get): cfg.CONF.set_override('name_unique', True, enforce_type=True) # Return an existing instance mock_get.return_value = mock.Mock() ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.receiver_create, self.ctx, 'r1', 'webhook', 'C1', 'CLUSTER_RESIZE') self.assertEqual(exc.BadRequest, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("The request is malformed: A receiver named 'r1' " "already exists.", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) def test_receiver_create_bad_type(self): ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.receiver_create, self.ctx, 'r1', 'rocket', 'C1', 'CLUSTER_RESIZE') self.assertEqual(exc.BadRequest, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("The request is malformed: Receiver type 'rocket' " "is not supported.", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'cluster_find') def test_receiver_create_webhook_cluster_not_found(self, mock_find): mock_find.side_effect = exc.ResourceNotFound(type='cluster', id='C1') ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.receiver_create, self.ctx, 'r1', 'webhook', 'C1', 'whatever') self.assertEqual(exc.BadRequest, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("The request is malformed: The referenced cluster " "(C1) could not be found.", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'cluster_find') @mock.patch.object(rb.Receiver, 'create') def test_receiver_create_webhook_forbidden(self, mock_create, mock_find): fake_cluster = mock.Mock() fake_cluster.user = 'someone' mock_find.return_value = fake_cluster ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.receiver_create, self.ctx, 'r1', 'webhook', 'C1', 'FLY') self.assertEqual(exc.Forbidden, ex.exc_info[0]) fake_receiver = mock.Mock(id='FAKE_RECIEVER') fake_receiver.to_dict.return_value = { 'id': 'FAKE_RECEIVER', 'foo': 'bar' } mock_create.return_value = fake_receiver # an admin can do this self.ctx.is_admin = True result = self.eng.receiver_create(self.ctx, 'r1', 'webhook', 'C1', 'CLUSTER_RESIZE') self.assertIsInstance(result, dict) # All other tests are done in 'test_receiver_create' @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'cluster_find') def test_receiver_create_webhook_bad_action(self, mock_find): fake_cluster = mock.Mock() fake_cluster.user = self.ctx.user mock_find.return_value = fake_cluster ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.receiver_create, self.ctx, 'r1', 'webhook', 'C1', 'DANCE') self.assertEqual(exc.BadRequest, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("The request is malformed: Illegal cluster action " "'DANCE' specified.", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) @mock.patch.object(rb.Receiver, 'create') def test_receiver_create_non_webhook_succeed(self, mock_create): fake_receiver = mock.Mock(id='FAKE_RECIEVER') fake_receiver.to_dict.return_value = { 'id': 'FAKE_RECEIVER', 'foo': 'bar' } mock_create.return_value = fake_receiver rtypes = consts.RECEIVER_TYPES consts.RECEIVER_TYPES = ('webhook', 'foo') result = self.eng.receiver_create(self.ctx, 'r1', 'foo', None, None) consts.RECEIVER_TYPES = rtypes self.assertIsInstance(result, dict) self.assertEqual('FAKE_RECEIVER', result['id']) mock_create.assert_called_once_with( self.ctx, 'foo', None, None, name='r1', user=self.ctx.user, project=self.ctx.project, domain=self.ctx.domain, params={}) @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'cluster_find') @mock.patch.object(rb.Receiver, 'create')

API support for receiver_create2

Change-Id: I8681a9757dfcfc01fdd6adad55bbde9d02a76c06

added_lines: from senlin.objects.requests import receivers as vorr def test_receiver_create_success(self, mock_enforce): 'action': 'CLUSTER_RESIZE', 'action': 'CLUSTER_RESIZE', mock_call = self.patchobject(rpc_client.EngineClient, 'call2', mock_call.assert_called_with(req.context, 'receiver_create2', mock.ANY) request = mock_call.call_args[0][2] self.assertIsInstance(request, vorr.ReceiverCreateRequestBody) self.assertEqual('test_receiver', request.name) self.assertEqual('webhook', request.type) self.assertEqual('FAKE_ID', request.cluster_id) self.assertEqual('CLUSTER_RESIZE', request.action) self.assertEqual({'user_id': 'test_user_id', 'password': 'test_pass'}, request.actor) self.assertEqual({'test_param': 'test_value'}, request.params) mock_call = self.patchobject(rpc_client.EngineClient, 'call2') self.assertEqual("Request body missing 'receiver' key.", six.text_type(ex)) def test_receiver_create_missing_required_field(self, mock_enforce): self._mock_enforce_setup(mock_enforce, 'create', True) body = { 'receiver': { 'name': 'test_receiver', 'cluster_id': 'FAKE_CLUSTER', 'action': 'CLUSTER_RESIZE', } } req = self._post('/receivers', jsonutils.dumps(body)) mock_call = self.patchobject(rpc_client.EngineClient, 'call2') ex = self.assertRaises(exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.controller.create, req, body=body) self.assertEqual("'type' is a required property", six.text_type(ex)) self.assertFalse(mock_call.called) 'action': 'CLUSTER_RESIZE', } } mock_call = self.patchobject(rpc_client.EngineClient, 'call2') ex = self.assertRaises(exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.controller.create, req, body=body) self.assertEqual("Value 'unsupported' is not acceptable for field " "'type'.", six.text_type(ex)) subject: Make gate-rally-dsvm-neutron-neutron voting in the neutron check queue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-04 17:42:53.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/9fdba336ad0eec8c35d4334606f80a9a29d71aed', 'message': 'Make gate-rally-dsvm-neutron-neutron voting in the neutron check queue

The decision stems from the fact that the job has been stable for some
time. Also, more scenarios are being added (e.g. [1]), and if momemtum
keeps up, it would be nice to ensure that the job stays green over
time.

Absence of the job on the gate queue is not an oversight. This is a
conscious decision the team is willing to make for the following
reasons:

a) rally runs can be expensive: every scenario may easily add 5-10
   more minutes to the whole runtime. This can have a bad compounding
   effect on the entire gate pipeline for integrated projects.
b) performance degradation may occasionally show up with the combination
   of two or more effects, the same way an intermittent failure may
   show up only after merge, however in fashion that may be less
   obvious to troubleshoot. To avoid crippling the entire gate until
   the issue is pinpointed and resolved, it is best to keep the effects
   of a potential instability confined to the neutron project only.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/392265/

Change-Id: I65c570ad0eb8aed6632dd0328b21904cc2cc008a
'}]
commit_message:
Make gate-rally-dsvm-neutron-neutron voting in the neutron check queue

The decision stems from the fact that the job has been stable for some
time. Also, more scenarios are being added (e.g. [1]), and if momemtum
keeps up, it would be nice to ensure that the job stays green over
time.

Absence of the job on the gate queue is not an oversight. This is a
conscious decision the team is willing to make for the following
reasons:

a) rally runs can be expensive: every scenario may easily add 5-10
   more minutes to the whole runtime. This can have a bad compounding
   effect on the entire gate pipeline for integrated projects.
b) performance degradation may occasionally show up with the combination
   of two or more effects, the same way an intermittent failure may
   show up only after merge, however in fashion that may be less
   obvious to troubleshoot. To avoid crippling the entire gate until
   the issue is pinpointed and resolved, it is best to keep the effects
   of a potential instability confined to the neutron project only.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/392265/

Change-Id: I65c570ad0eb8aed6632dd0328b21904cc2cc008a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/81/393881/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-zookeeper project

This creates an empty ansible role to manage zookeeper. Currently not
part of big tent, and will add IRC notifications to windmill.

By default we are adding a few non-voting jobs, but first order will
be to make them voting.

Change-Id: I59b87cc4e247fc42fa63bfa76ed94ab9ae47beb9
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add experimental upgrade job for os_keystone

This patch implements an additional scenario test for upgrading between
releases of the OpenStack-Ansible keystone role.

The test will be initially skipped for all branches other than master.

Change-Id: I189df63fa7fe49ab2fe5b3d0aafc5eff554a48e6

commit_message:
add new synchronizer plugin doc

Change-Id: I40f930c12029e9f2191f3ef48b848b0fb63bbcad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/22/295022/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =========================== Add New Synchronizer Plugin =========================== Add Plugin Package - HOW TO --------------------------- In order to add a new synchronizer plugin to Vitrage do the following steps: 1. Have your plugin enclosed in a package with the plugins' name and put it under 'vitrage.synchronizer.plugins'. 2. Under your plugin package, have both your plugins' synchronizer class your plugins' transformer class. See below for details on those classes. 3. Under your plugins' package __init__.py you must import cfg from oslo_config and declare a list named OPTS. Under OPTS, you can define your needed options using the oslo_config.cfg module. There are two options you must have - transformer and synchronizer with the path to your transformer and synchronizer classes respectively. In addition to those two, you may add any other configuration options you may need for your plugin. 4. Add your plugin name under the plugin_type list found in vitrage.synchronizer.plugins.__init__.py 5. In case you want your plugin to get registered under other names i.e. for other sub-entities, add a list option named 'entities' under which list all of your sub-entities names. 6. You are done! Synchronizer Class __________________ Responsible for importing information regarding entities in the cloud. Entities in this context refer both to resources (physical & virtual) and alarms (Aodh, Nagios, Monasca, etc.) The Synchronizer can hold several plugins, each responsible for a different entity type, like Nova instance, Nova host, Nova zone, Nagios alarms, Aodh alarms, etc. The plugin has two modes of action: get_all (snapshot): Query all entities and send events to the queue. When done, send an "end" event. notify: Send an event to the queue upon any change. For more details, see https://github.com/openstack/vitrage-specs/blob/master/specs/mitaka/vitrage-synchronizer.rst A synchronizer should inherit from 'vitrage.synchronizer.plugins.synchronizer_base.SynchronizerBase' class and must implement the following methods: +----------------------+------------------------------------+--------------------------------+ | Name | Input | Output | +======================+====================================+================================+ | get_all | sync mode | void | +----------------------+------------------------------------+--------------------------------+ | get_changes | sync mode | void | +----------------------+------------------------------------+--------------------------------+ Transformer Class _________________ The Transformer plugin understands the specific entity details, queries the Vitrage Graph, and outputs a vertex to be inserted to the Vitrage Graph together with edges that connect it to its neighbors. Note that for every Synchronizer plugin there should be a matching Transformer plugin. A transformer should inherit from 'vitrage.synchronizer.plugins.transformer_base.TransformerBase' class and must implement the following methods: +----------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------------------------------+ | Name | Input | Output | +============================+====================================+========================================+ | transform | entity event | entity wrapper | +----------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------------------------------+ | key_values | a tuple of mutable key fields | The fields which consist the entity key| +----------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------------------------------+ | extract_key | entity event | key | +----------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------------------------------+ | create_placeholder_vertex | properties | Placeholder vertex | +----------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------------------------------+ Configuration _____________ Holds the following fields: +----------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------------------------------+ | Name | Type | Description | +============================+====================================+========================================+ | transformer | string - Required! | Transformer class path under vitrage | +----------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------------------------------+ | synchronizer | string - Required! | Synchronizer class path under vitrage | +----------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------------------------------+ | changes_interval | integer - Optional | Interval between checking for changes | +----------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------------------------------+ | entities | string list - Optional | Sub-entities of the plugin | +----------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------------------------------+ **Example** Plugin __init__.py OPTS: .. code:: python from oslo_config import cfg OPTS = [ cfg.StrOpt('transformer', default='vitrage.synchronizer.plugins.static_physical.' 'transformer.StaticPhysicalTransformer', help='Static physical transformer class path', required=True), cfg.StrOpt('synchronizer', default='vitrage.synchronizer.plugins.static_physical' '.synchronizer.StaticPhysicalSynchronizer', help='Static physical synchronizer class path', required=True), cfg.IntOpt('changes_interval', default=30, min=30, help='interval between checking changes in the configuration' 'files of the physical topology plugin', required=True), cfg.StrOpt('directory', default='/etc/vitrage/static_plugins', help='Static physical plugins directory'), cfg.ListOpt('entities', default=['switch'], help='Static physical entity types list') ] **Example** plugins.__init__.py plugin list: .. code:: python OPTS = [ cfg.ListOpt('plugin_type', default=['nagios', 'nova.host', 'nova.instance', 'nova.zone', 'static_physical'], help='Names of supported plugins'), ] What Happens Next ----------------- Now, when loading Vitrage, vitrage.synchronizer.plugins.launcher.Launcher will get instantiated and will register all of the plugins synchronizers into Vitrage. Note, that if you want your synchronizer to also run as a service i.e. get changes every <interval> you need to set under your plugins' OPTS an Integer option named 'changes_interval'. Additionally, vitrage.entity_graph.transformer_manager.TransformerManager will get instantiated and will register all of the plugins transformers into Vitrage. These two steps are using your previously configured synchronizer and transformer path options under your plugins' package __init__.OPTS. Plugin Options -------------- Any option your plugin defined can be accessed using oslo_config.cfg or by configuring vitrage.conf. **Example** .. code:: python cfg.<plugin_name>.<option_name>

add an existing plugin doc

Change-Id: Ia9f79e086d9879ba32dae5fa929720f3e38889f4

added_lines: =================================== Add an Existing Synchronizer Plugin =================================== Add Plugin Package - HOW TO --------------------------- In order to add a plugin to Vitrage follow these steps: 1. Copy the plugin package to be under 'vitrage.synchronizer.plugins'. 2. Add the plugin name under the plugin_type list found in vitrage.synchronizer.plugins.__init__.py 3. Edit any plugin configuration parameters in 'vitrage.conf' configuration file under 'vitrage/etc/vitrage' 4. You are done! Configuration _____________ **Example** [<plugin_name>] # # From plugins # # <plugin_name> transformer class path (string value) transformer = vitrage.synchronizer.plugins.<plugin_name>.transformer.Transformer # <plugin_name> synchronizer class path (string value) synchronizer = vitrage.synchronizer.plugins.<plugin_name>.synchronizer.Synchronizer # interval between checking changes of the <plugin_name> (integer value) # Minimum value: 30 changes_interval = 30 # <plugin_name> host ip (string value) ip = 127.0.0.1 # <plugin_name> entity types list (list value) entities = [<plugin_type1>, <plugin_type2>]

deleted_lines: def cluster_delete(self, ctxt, identity, cast=True): rpc_method = self.cast if cast else self.call return rpc_method(ctxt, self.make_msg('cluster_delete', identity=identity)) def cluster_collect(self, ctxt, identity, path, project_safe=True): return self.call(ctxt, self.make_msg('cluster_collect', identity=identity, path=path, project_safe=project_safe), version='1.1') def cluster_replace_nodes(self, ctxt, identity, nodes=None): return self.call(ctxt, self.make_msg('cluster_replace_nodes', identity=identity, nodes=nodes)) def node_delete(self, ctxt, identity, cast=True): rpc_method = self.cast if cast else self.call return rpc_method(ctxt, self.make_msg('node_delete', identity=identity))

cluster_delete service from engine.

commit_message:
Add new methods to resize and check disks for cinder\ceph nodes

Add new method 'get_node_disks_by_volume_name' for fuel_web client
Add new parametr in 'update_node_partitioning'
Add new parametr in 'get_node_partition_size'
Add new method 'check_partition_exists' to checkers
Adapting test 'cinder_ceph_for_images_ephemeral_rados' for new methods

Related blueprint run-fuel-qa-on-baremetal

Change-Id: Iae281d7066fdcea1571b787f738fa87a962ad56d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/05/382805/25 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_node_disks_by_volume_name(self, node, volume_name): disks_volumes = {disk['name']: volume['name'] for disk in self.client.get_node_disks(node) for volume in disk['volumes'] if volume['size'] > 0} return filter(lambda x: disks_volumes[x] == volume_name, disks_volumes) @logwrap

subject: The object server returns the policy index
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-06 23:46:07.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/server.py', 'swift/common/middleware/copy.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/fb6a1b51e1622c9eb149d75c3785ac90cdb04fec', 'message': 'The object server returns the policy index

in the object server responses.
It will be included in any exception responses as well.
The response relies on the result of get_name_and_placement.
The header is included in the
GET, HEAD, POST, PUT and REPLICATE verbs.
The policy index of the source of a copy will not be used
for the following PUT request.

Closes-Bug: 1634382

Change-Id: I821416b72ac4f9cd05c32073b2f02d13f8ee4888
'}]
commit_message:
The object server returns the policy index

The X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index header will be included
in the object server responses.
It will be included in any exception responses as well.
The response relies on the result of get_name_and_placement.
The header is included in the
GET, HEAD, POST, PUT and REPLICATE verbs.
The policy index of the source of a copy will not be used
for the following PUT request.

Closes-Bug: 1634382

Change-Id: I821416b72ac4f9cd05c32073b2f02d13f8ee4888
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/10/394210/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

self.assertEqual(resp.headers['X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index'], expected_policy) # Object o was created with another policy req = Request.blank('/sda1/p/a/c/o', environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': 'GET'}) self._set_policy_index_header_if_necessary(req, other_policy) resp = req.get_response(self.object_controller) self.assertEqual(resp.status_int, 404) self.assertEqual(resp.headers['X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index'], other_policy) req = Request.blank('/sda1/p/a/c/o', environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': 'HEAD'}) self._set_policy_index_header_if_necessary(req, other_policy) resp = req.get_response(self.object_controller) self.assertEqual(resp.status_int, 404) self.assertEqual(resp.headers['X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index'], other_policy) timestamp = utils.Timestamp(start + 0.00001) req = Request.blank('/sda1/p/a/c/o', environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': 'DELETE'}, headers={'X-Timestamp': normalize_timestamp(timestamp)}) self._set_policy_index_header_if_necessary(req, policy) resp = req.get_response(self.object_controller) self.assertEqual(resp.status_int, 204) do_test(POLICIES[0], POLICIES[1]) do_test(POLICIES[1], environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': 'DELETE'}, headers={'X-Timestamp': normalize_timestamp( utils.Timestamp(start + 0.00002))}) self._set_policy_index_header_if_necessary(req, policy) resp = req.get_response(self.object_controller) self.assertEqual(resp.status_int, 204) self.assertEqual(resp.headers['X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index'], expected_policy) req = Request.blank( '/sda1/p/a/c/o', environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': 'DELETE'}, headers={'X-Timestamp': normalize_timestamp( utils.Timestamp(start + 0.00002))}) self._set_policy_index_header_if_necessary(req, policy) resp = req.get_response(self.object_controller) self.assertEqual(resp.status_int, 404) self.assertEqual(resp.headers['X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index'], expected_policy) do_test(POLICIES[0]) commit_message:
Fix DB API transaction()

* start_tx() should not be under 'try' because we can't do
  any clean up actions if it fails. The best thing we can do is
  to bubble up the error to the user.

Change-Id: Id2c12cd0837673d52260c58782327570745968ce
Partial-Bug: #1638805

commit_message:
Object and engine prep for cluster-delete v2

This adds versioned objects and engine layer preparation for handling
cluster-delete RPC requests that passes an object as request parameter.

Change-Id: If3ad13f7dce4a94dfa7c84ba7682e7d1d3a0125c

commit_message:
Fixes sphinx warnings and errors.

1. Change image references to local paths.
2. Fix underline too short issues.
3. Fix numbered/unnumbered lists.
4. Fix unindented ascii art
5. Fix line break issues
6. Fix naming typo in index.rst

There is still a reference to an unknown document in
source/index.rst (centralized_dragonflow).

Change-Id: Icae76f769f0f0236406997f548eb526a4ec2f90c
